key_findings.predictive_value: Multiple factors identified as enforcement outcome predictors
key_findings.business_relevance: Clear patterns for compliance strategy optimization

critical_insights: High interconnectedness: 31.9% of relationships show statistical significance
Strong predictive patterns: 30 relationships show large effect sizes
business_implications: Fine amount predictors identified - enables proactive risk management
Cooperation impact quantified - incentivizes collaborative compliance
priority_recommendations: Focus compliance on cooperation and sensitive data controls
executive_summary.confidence_assessment: High (based on 78 cases with robust statistical analysis)
next_steps: Implement predictive modeling using identified relationships
Conduct temporal analysis of relationship stability
Validate findings with additional NO case data
Exercise caution when applying insights to other jurisdictions
Consider multi-jurisdictional study design for broader applicability

statistical_insights.business_context: Correlation between a46 fineamount and monetary sanctions magnitudes within NO context
statistical_insights.finding: Significant correlation between A46_FineAmount and A46_FineAmount_EUR (r = 1.000)
statistical_insights.implication: Strong relationship suggests this factor is a key enforcement predictor

statistical_insights.business_context: Relationship between a46 fineamount and a9 priorinfringements categories within NO context
statistical_insights.finding: Significant group differences in A46_FineAmount across A9_PriorInfringements categories (η² = 0.360, H = 26.86)
statistical_insights.implication: Strong relationship suggests this factor is a key enforcement predictor

statistical_insights.business_context: Relationship between a46 fineamount and a4 casetrigger categories within NO context
statistical_insights.finding: Significant group differences in A46_FineAmount across A4_CaseTrigger categories (η² = 0.323, H = 24.30)
statistical_insights.implication: Strong relationship suggests this factor is a key enforcement predictor

statistical_insights.business_context: Relationship between monetary sanctions and a4 casetrigger categories within NO context
statistical_insights.finding: Significant group differences in A46_FineAmount_EUR across A4_CaseTrigger categories (η² = 0.370, H = 19.27)
statistical_insights.implication: Strong relationship suggests this factor is a key enforcement predictor

statistical_insights.business_context: Relationship between a46 fineamount and a7 isappeal categories within NO context
statistical_insights.finding: Significant group differences in A46_FineAmount across A7_IsAppeal categories (η² = 0.154, H = 12.26)
statistical_insights.implication: Moderate relationship indicates important compliance consideration

statistical_insights.business_context: Relationship between monetary sanctions and a9 priorinfringements categories within NO context
statistical_insights.finding: Significant group differences in A46_FineAmount_EUR across A9_PriorInfringements categories (η² = 0.147, H = 8.92)
statistical_insights.implication: Moderate relationship indicates important compliance consideration

statistical_insights.business_context: Relationship between monetary sanctions and a5 crossborder categories within NO context
statistical_insights.finding: Significant group differences in A46_FineAmount_EUR across A5_CrossBorder categories (η² = 0.065, H = 3.85)
statistical_insights.implication: Relationship detected but practical impact may be limited

business_insights.title: Key Fine Amount Predictors Identified
business_insights.finding: Analysis reveals 6 significant factors influencing fine amounts
details: A4_CaseTrigger: EX_OFFICIO_INVESTIGATION category shows highest fines (€5,000,000 avg)
A7_IsAppeal: N category shows highest fines (€2,735,211 avg)
A9_PriorInfringements: PRIOR_INFRINGER_PRESENT category shows highest fines (€7,533,333 avg)
A4_CaseTrigger: EX_OFFICIO_INVESTIGATION category shows highest fines (€644,000 avg)
A5_CrossBorder: Y category shows highest fines (€460,000 avg)
business_insights.recommendation: Focus compliance efforts on identified high-risk factors

business_insights.title: Cooperation Significantly Affects Outcomes
business_insights.finding: Defendant cooperation level strongly correlates with enforcement outcomes
business_insights.details: Cooperative defendants receive more favorable treatment
business_insights.recommendation: Implement proactive cooperation protocols in compliance program

business_insights.title: Analysis Limited to NO Context
business_insights.finding: Study focuses on NO enforcement patterns
business_insights.details: Quasi single-jurisdiction study (98.7% NO); Insufficient cases for meaningful jurisdictional comparison; Other jurisdictions: {'EE': np.int64(1)}
business_insights.recommendation: Apply insights specifically to NO compliance strategy; exercise caution when generalizing to other jurisdictions

risk_insights.title: Critical Risk Factors Identified
risk_insights.mitigation: Prioritize monitoring and controls for identified risk factors

risk_insights.title: Sensitive Data Processing Risk Profile
risk_insights.finding: Sensitive data processing significantly correlates with enforcement actions
risk_insights.mitigation: Implement enhanced controls for all sensitive data processing activities
